Common.Highlight.Common.Text: Three private, paved, off-street parking spaces* in the rear  (*on a first come, first served basis)
Property inspected by structural engineer in 2020
Basement dehumidifier runs 24/7 to prevent moisture
Units 1, 2 and 4 – HVAC units around 12 years old
Tenants reimburse landlord for water monthly

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
High ceilings, and decorative coal fireplaces. The roof was replaced in 2015, new sidewalks in 2016. The building was recently (May 2021) re-pointed along with structural support enhancements completed. The building has the historic charm of Richmond, VA with Maple Tree lined streets and walk-ability to world-class museums and restaurants.

Virginia Commonwealth University “VCU” is located within seven blocks and numerous neighborhood parks are quaintly situated throughout.   The neighborhood provides an exorbitant amount of amenities with restaurants, bars, neighborhood shops and groceries. The “Fan” is one of the most desirable places to live in the city of Richmond.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Grayland Avenue is at the epicenter for food, entertainment, and culture of Richmond! Within 3 blocks of Carytown, Museum District, and The Fan- with an abundance of restaurants, shops, museums, and entertainment. Adjacent is Byrd Park with its extensive selection of running and walking trails, tennis courts, and paddle boats on Fountain Lake. Ride your bike or take a bus ride into city center and downtown or Belle and Brown's Island- known for outdoor concerts and festivals, kayaking, paddle boarding, as well as biking and hiking paths.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
Property is comprised of two buildings: 2400 Grayland- 100,630 SF and 2501 Grayland- 15,148 SF, totaling 115,778 SF on 4.6 Acres, ideal for adaptive redevelopment. 

- 115,778 building SF
- Site total: 4.6 Acres
- Surface Parking: 1.7 Acres
- Eligible for Historic tax credits
- Centrally located

2400 Grayland Avenue Property Summary:
- 100,630 SF building
- 10,500 SF courtyard
- Built in 1935
- 2.02 Acres

2501 Grayland Avenue Property Summary:
- 15,148  SF
- Built in 1940
- 0.96 Acres
